alert.note: Alert for Hot Springs (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Hot Springs. * WHEN...Until 930 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 629 PM MDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain along portions of Highway 170 due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Portions of Highway 170 is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. This includes streams and drainages along and near the Owl Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Thermopolis, Lucerne, Kirby, Hamilton Dome, Hot Springs State Park, Hot Springs County Airport, and Hot Springs County Fairgrounds. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
